title: As a CBT Admin, I want Clubs' share of pre-arb bonus pool reflected on the Payroll reports
custom_steps:
AC:

* The pro-rata share of Clubs' pre-arb bonus pool will be added to the Payroll reports as a new Benefits line item on the CBT versions of the reports:
** Payroll - Team Details
** Payroll - Player Details
* There will be a new line for this on the player details version, showing up below the extended benefits line and displaying in the same manner
* On the team details, because there isn't enough space on the report to add another column, the benefits and extended benefits columns on the team details will be combined into a "Total Benefits" column.  The new value will be added as its own column
* The Player details total of all three benefits should match the team reports total benefits column
* The total Payroll values on each report should be the same for all teams
* On the player details, this line item shouldn't appear for reports prior to 2022
* On the team details, the columns can be merged for all years, but the totals should not be impacted in years prior to 2022

title: As a League Economics user I want a "Guaranteed" checkbox added to Major Contract conditional player options
custom_steps:
In order to account for contracts like McMahon's ([https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/major-contract/contract?mjcId=31008483&playerId=378542)|https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/major-contract/contract?mjcId=31008483&playerId=378542)] which have conditional player options which are actually considered guaranteed we will add a new checkbox to conditional options when the if met will become selection is set to player.
The checkbox is only editable by BOC users and defaults to being unchecked (the option is not considered guaranteed).

If the checkbox is checked, the payroll calculations will be updated to treat this conditional option as a regular player option rather than a conditional option.  

Whether or not the option is checked should also be factored into the total guaranteed and AAV calculations.

AC:

* There is a new guaranteed_flag added to the mjc_option table
* There is a new Guaranteed added to the Major Contract option clause when the option type is Conditional and the will become value is Player
* If the guaranteed_flag is true then the payroll calculations will treat this option like a regular player option
* If the guaranteed_flag is true then the AAV and Total Compensation calculations will treat this option like a regular player option
* This should default to not checked

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a "Return of Replacement Player" checkbox added to the Optional Assignment TX
custom_steps:
If a player is recalled as a "Replacement Player," they can be optioned back down to the minor leagues without the option counting towards their in-season option limit.  To facilitate this, if the player is a replacement player, a "Return of Replacement Player" checkbox will be added to the Outright Assignment transaction.  Only BOC can check the box, however it will be visible to club users.  If the box is visible it is required for submission.  It should not be required when it is not visible.  When the box is checked the player does not need to pass through waivers and therefore the consent, contemplated outright form, minor league service, and waiver rule checks should be skipped for submission and approval.

AC:
 - An Optional Assignment for a player who is flagged as a replacement player will display a "Return of Replacement Player" checkbox.  Unchecked by default and editable only by BOC users.  The checkbox is required for submission/approval.
 - An Optional Assignment for a player flagged as a replacement player will not count towards the players in-season limit (https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1247)
 - Upon approval of the Optional Assignment with the checkbox checked, the player will no longer be flagged as a replacement player (PRO_PLAYER.REPLACEMENT_FLAG)
 - If the checkbox is checked the transaction bulletin entry for the Optional Assignment will say "Return of Replacement Player"
 - If the checkbox is checked the player history entry for the Optional Assignment will say "Return of Replacement Player"
 - An Optional Assignment for a player who is NOT flagged as a replacement player will work as normal and will not display or require that the Replacement Player checkbox be checked.

title: As a BOC Admin, I don't want any restriction on players Recalled as Replacement Players
custom_steps:
Players Selected as replacement players have certain restriction on them (may not be optioned or traded).  Players recalled as replacement players will not have any restrictions on them.

AC:
 - Players recalled as replacement players may be included in outright trades.  Club users will not get any errors when including them.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a "Substitute Player" checkbox added to the Recall transaction
custom_steps:
Currently, players have the ability to be Selected to the MJ Roster as a Substitute Player.  We are going to extend this ability to Recalled players.

AC:
 - There will be a new checkbox on the RECOP transaction labeled: "Substitute Player"
 - The box will only be editable by BOC users
 - The box will be visible to club users, but disabled
 - If the box is checked, the PRO_PLAYER.REPLACEMENT_FLAG field will be set to 1
 - If the box is checked, the transaction bulletin entry for the selection will say: "Recall from <club> by <MJ club> as Substitute Player
 - If the box is checked, the line item in the player history widget for the selection will say: "Recall - Substitute Player"

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Clubs prevented from exceeding the in-season option limit
custom_steps:
AC:
 - On submission and approval of a new Optional Assignment transaction, the system will perform a check to see if the player has reached the allotted in-season option limit
 - If player is at or above the limit (i.e. 5 with no asterisk), the system will return a hard error for clubs and a soft warning for BOC users
  -- Text: This player has reach the in-season limit for optional assignments.  Please contact the BOC.
  -- Buttons: Ignore and Continue (BOC Only), Back
 - If the player is below the limit, or at or above the limit with an asterisk, there is no error or warning message returned

title: As a BOC Admin, I want system logic to determine which Options count towards the current season limit
custom_steps:
*+5-option Limit:+*
Starting 2022, players will be limited to 5 optional assignments during the season, meaning they may be only optioned 5 times throughout the 2022 season â€“ with a few exceptions:
-	Options that occur prior to the new "First Day of Option Tracking" system date will not count towards the limit of 5
  -- If that date is blank, Opening Day will be used as the default
-	Additionally, if a player has used his 5 options (5 of 5) and is subsequently assigned to another club via trade or outright waiver claim, the assignee Club gains the ability to option that player one additional time (5 of 5*).
  -- This extra option is granted each time the player is assigned, so long as he is already at the limit of 5, and is indicated in eBIS by the asterisk on his option count.
  -- The asterisk will never appear unless the player is 5 of 5, meaning the player does not continue to add options upon assignments to other clubs unless the player has already maxed out the total number of permissible options.  (If he is a 3 of 5 and traded, he remains at 3 of 5.)
-	In the event a player is on option when assigned, and the assignee Club immediately options the player upon acquisition (up and over within 24 hours of acquisition), that optional assignment does NOT count as one of the 5 permissible options.
-	If a player is returned as a replacement player, that option will *NOT* count as an option

title: As a League Economics user I want to update the Valley Option determination to ignore the buyout
custom_steps:
In order to determine if an option year is considered a valley option its salary is compared to the yearly average salary and checked to see if its less than 80% of the salary.  Clubs were giving high buyouts on these options and keeping the salary right at 80% to avoid the valley option charge.  The new CBA addresses this with the following language:


Modify Article XXIII(E)(5)(d)(ii) to deduct any buyout from the Option Year salary when calculating the Player Option Year Value for the purposes of assessing whether the Player Option Year Value is above or below the 80% Figure.

To address this, we will now subtract the buyout from the option year salary for making the determination on whether it is a valley option.

AC:

* an option will be deemed a valley option if the salary minus the buyout is below the 80% value.
* This will only apply to contracts signed after 3/10/2022 - prior signings are not subject to this rule

title: As a League Economics user I want the CBT calculation for an assignee club to be updated when the player is traded.
custom_steps:
The 2022 CBA has the following language:

Assignee Club

# If the UPC is assigned between championship seasons, the Playerâ€™s Salary attributable to the assignee Club will be calculated as if the contract begins with the season following the assignment.
# If the UPC is assigned during a championship season, the Playerâ€™s Salary attributable to the assignee Club will be recalculated pursuant to Article XXIII(C)(2)(c) as if the UPC begins with the day following the assignment.

What this means for ebis is that upon a trade for a player with an MJC, the CBT calculations will consider the outright trade to be the start of the contract when determining the remaining yearâ€™s CBT charges for the assignee club.

AC:

* When a contract is traded, the assignee team will receive CBT charges as if the trade date was the signing date of the contract.
* This update will only apply to any assignments occurring after 3/10/2022 - assignments prior to that will not have this charge upon being traded.

title: As a League Economics user I want the CBT calculation for an assignor club to be updated when the player is traded.
custom_steps:
The new CBA has the following language:


If the total compensation the assignor Club has paid the Player
under the assigned UPC exceeds the amount that has been
allocated to Actual Club Payroll, the difference shall be
prorated over the remaining guaranteed years of the UPC and
included in Actual Club Payroll of the assignor Club.

What this means is that upon a trade, if the CBT charges that have been paid by the assignor club up until that point in the contract will be totaled up and compared tot he LRD charges they have accrued to that point.  If the LRD charges are HIGHER than the CBT charge than the difference between the two will be considered a CBT true up charge and will be given to the assignor club, prorated over the remaining years of the contract.

In the case of an in season trade - the current year will be a fractional portion of the total.  For example, if there is a 1,000,000 true up charge to be applied and the trade happens exactly half way through the season then the prorating will be by 1.5 years: 1,000,000 / 1.5 = 666,666.67 with .5 of that being applied to year one (333,333) and the full value in year two (666,667).

Example calculations are attached

AC:

* A traded contract with lower total CBT charge paid out up until the trade than their LRD salary paid out to that point will be applied a â€˜true upâ€™ charge which will be prorated over the remainder of the contracts guaranteed years.
* This update will only apply to any assignments occurring after 3/10/2022 - assignments prior to that will not have this charge upon being traded.

title: As a user, I want the CBT Assessment report updated to account for the new threshold
custom_steps:
The new CBA introduces a "third" threshold amount (its actually the fourth threshold, if you count the fact that the "base" is the first.  On the system values screen, this is now the "CBT Third Surcharge Threshold".

The Competitive Balance Tax Assessment report is used to determine which orgs are over the thresholds and calculate their actual tax charges.  Starting with 2022, it will need to be modified as follows: 

* display a 'Third Surcharge Threshold'
* change the >$40 (2nd Surcharge) to $40-$60 (2nd Surcharge)
* Add a new >$60 (3rd Surcharge) line with appropriate percentages
** The actual value for he third threshold for 2022 will be $290M
* Correctly calculate tax above the third surcharge according to the specified percentages.  
* Actual percentages defined in the CBA for the third surcharge are:
** 1st time payor: 80%
** 2nd time payor: 90%
** 3rd time payor: 110%

title: As a user, I want to see Dues Days on the player profile in the Breakdown widget
custom_steps:
* Dues Days column will be added to the Breakdown widget on the player profile service tab
* Data will display with the ORG code followed by a dash then the incrementing count for number of days.  EX: BOS - 1, BOS - 2, BOS - 3
* If the date the player was terminated was a spring training date prior to 15 days before the season starts, the dues days column will indicate 30 days (BOS - 30)
* If the date the player was terminated was a spring training date after 15 days before the season starts, the dues days column will indicate 45 days (BOS - 45)
* Some rows may have no other data, this will happen when the player is terminated

title: As a user, I want to see Dues Days on the player profile in the Major League Summary widget
custom_steps:
* The player profile Major League Summary widget on the service tab will be updated to display a Dues Days column.  
* The column will pull data from the PRO_MJ_SERVICE.DUES_DAYS field
* The column will not be editable by any user

title: As a user, I want the service calculation to calculate dues days for all appropriate players after completing the service calcs
custom_steps:
Service calculations will need to:

* Make use of the existing pro roster information to determine dues days based on the logic laid out in the EPIC ([PIVOTAL-1122])
* Interrogate contract information for any player who was terminated and has a terminated contract year covering the current year in an efficient manner (one query running to fetch all data into supporting data and not a query per service run)
* Insert a record into the PRO_PLAYER_DUES_DAYS table for each day that is being deducted
* Insert a record for each spring training termination, indicating whether or not it was prior to or after the cutoff date for 30/45 days
* Total up the counts of dues days by org and enter them into the PRO_MJ_SERVICE table dues_days column for the appropriate org.  A new record may need to be created if the org has no other service information for the year
* Each run of the service calc should calculate the dues days in full for the current year and update the database appropriately
* The following rules govern when a dues day should be deducted:
** If the player is active on a given day during the major league season, deduct one day from their current club
** If they are released during spring training and clear waivers prior to 15 days before the first day of the major league season, they are deducted 30 days.
** If they are released during spring training and clear waivers 15 days or fewer before the first day of the major league season, they are deducted 45 days.
** They continue to receive dues days following a release through the end of the season.
** When Optioned, the date of the option will be deducted, but no further dates while on option.
** When Outrighted, the date of the outright will be deducted, but no further dates while outrighted.
** If the player is traded the assignor (former) club deducts the date of the trade.
** If the player is option when traded, the assignee (new) club deducts starting with the date the player reports to the major league team.
** If the player is designated for assignment, all days while DFA are deducted leading up to and including the date of assignment.
** If a player is terminated while on a multi year contract, all days during the major league season for years covered under the existing contract will be deducted by the terminating club (this will include future seasons).
** If a player who was terminated signs a major league contract with a new club, the old terminating club stops deducting and the new club begins deductions starting with the date the player is added to the major league roster and the old club will no longer deduct as of that date. If the player is added in the off season, the new club will start counting as of the first day of the major league season.
**# If the player elects free agency with type XIXA(2) from the new club and there is still time remaining on the prior clubâ€™s terminated contract - that club will continue to count dues days starting with the date the player elects free agency.

title: As a developer I want to create the database structure to support Dues Days
custom_steps:
Create a new PRO_PLAYER_DUES_DAYS table with player_id, roster_dt, org_id, and either flags to indicate an early vs late spring training release or a dues days type (which requires also creating a dues_days_type table).

Table should have the standard audit information and row_updated trigger for updated_ts.
All appropriate foreign keys should be created.



The PRO_MJ_SERVICE will have a DUES_DAYS integer column added

title: INC0182334 - New eBIS field - "Dues Days"
custom_steps:
Dues Days are days under which a player is charged union dues so that clubs are aware of how much to deduct from the playerâ€™s paychecks.

In general a player will be deducted one day for each active day they are on the major league roster during the season, the following rules also apply:

# If they are released during spring training and clear waivers prior to 15 days before the first day of the major league season, they are deducted 30 days.
# If they are released during spring training and clear waivers 15 days or fewer before the first day of the major league season, they are deducted 45 days.
# They continue to receive dues days following a release through the end of the season.
# When Optioned, the date of the option will be deducted, but no further dates while on option.
# When Outrighted, the date of the outright will be deducted, but no further dates while outrighted.
# If the player is traded the assignor (former) club deducts the date of the trade.
# If the player is option when traded, the assignee (new) club deducts starting with the date the player reports to the major league team.
# If the player is designated for assignment, all days while DFA are deducted leading up to and including the date of assignment.
# If a player is terminated while on a multi year contract, all days during the major league season for years covered under the existing contract will be deducted by the terminating club (this will include future seasons).
# If a player who was terminated signs a major league contract with a new club, the old terminating club stops deducting and the new club begins deductions starting with the date the player is added to the major league roster and the old club will no longer deduct as of that date.  If the player is added in the off season, the new club will start counting as of the first day of the major league season.
## If the player elects free agency with type XIXA(2) from the new club and there is still time remaining on the prior clubâ€™s terminated contract - that club will continue to count dues days starting with the date the player elects free agency.



We will be displaying Dues Days on the player profile service tab in both the major league summary widget - showing each orgâ€™s total for the year and in the breakdown widget - in a column with an increasing count with the org specified. 



Jeff sent in the following request via SNOW:
Received from: jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com
Recipients: ebissupport@mlb.com,travis.buck@mlb.com,Garrett.Horan@mlb.com,jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com,rreuter@lbisoftware.com,matthew.salvatore@mlb.com,Vanish.Grover@mlb.com,Paul.Mifsud@mlb.com

EBIS â€“ 

For 2022, we will need to create a â€œDues Daysâ€� field in eBIS that counts number of days during season where player is paid his ML salaryâ€¦including days after release. This field should be located in the Service tab (see below).Â  Additionally, could we have a day by day breakdown column added to the service breakdown utility in the service tab > (see below).

See the attached for detailed guidelines.Â  For this purpose, the day of option (whether pre or post game) will be a ML pay day (dues day).Â  Also, if a player is designated off the ML Active roster, the days designated should be included.Â  If designated off option, the designated days should not be included.

Like we do for MLS, could we also have it broken down by Club in any year in which the player is with more than one Club?Â  

Thanks\!

This will likely be broken up into further stories, just entering this as a placeholder so it doesn't get lost

title: INC0179369 - As a MNC Admin, I want Date to be required on the Life Insurance Consent Form to be required if the player signs the form
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When a player signs the Life Insurance Consent form, the date field will become required

NOTE: If we are not able to have conditionally required fields in esign, we should explore options to avoid having players submit signed forms with a blank date (this renders them invalid and the entire contract needs to be esigned again)
  -- Other options may include populating it with the MNC Signing Date
